settings.heading: UTR Dingles
settings.description: UTR Sports has added a new game type! UTR Dingles is a fun points-based game for four players of any age and gender to play singles and doubles simultaneously. Universal Tennis has added UTR Dingles at no additional cost for providers. Players can use the Create Play feature on the web to host their own UTR Dingles games.

settings.heading: WATCH: Learn More About UTR Dingles
UTR Dingles 101
settings.list: To play, you need four players, two balls, and one court. To start, players toss a coin to determine the feeding (“serving”) team. The two “serving” players on the same team feed cross-court rallies simultaneously and play out half-court points.
settings.list2: When a cross-court singles point ends (by error or winner), the winning player calls out, “Dingles!” Using the ball that is still in play, the point immediately evolves into a normal full-court doubles point.
settings.list3: Teams must win both the singles and doubles points to score a point. When a team wins both points, they get to feed (“serve”). Teammates change half-court sides only when they score a point on their serve. UTR Dingles score reporting is free.

settings.heading: UTR Dingles
settings.description: UTR Sports has added UTR Dingles at no additional cost for providers. It’s simple, just select it from the “format” dropdown menu when you create an event. Providers can host UTR Dingles by selecting it from the “format” drop-down menu when creating events in the same place that they indicate singles or doubles game types.

settings.heading: UTR Dingles
settings.description: Players can use the Create Play feature on the UTR Sports iOS and Android apps,  and on the web, to host their own UTR Dingles games by selecting it from the "format" drop-down menu. Set the location and time, and players can register. UTR Sports users can search for casual or organized UTR Dingles events nearby. UTR Dingles score reporting is free.

settings.heading: Why pickleball?
settings.row_content: Universal Tennis communities want to organize and play pickleball. Universal Tennis is excited to begin the next chapter by bringing a new pickleball rating and technology solutions to support our communities.

settings.heading: I play pickleball. How do I get my rating?
settings.row_content: All Universal Tennis club customers can access the new pickleball event management software at no additional cost. All players can get a personal rating for free by answering a few onboarding/registration questions.

settings.heading: I don’t play pickleball. Do I have to have a rating for it?
settings.row_content: No. You have a choice! As a trusted, long-term partner in tennis, Universal Tennis will strive to deliver the same in pickleball with a full suite of products tailored for pickleball. Providers and players will have the ability to choose tennis only, pickleball only, or both sports.

settings.heading: How will my pickleball rating be calculated?
settings.row_content: Universal Tennis will carry over its success as the creator of the world’s most accurate UTR Rating for tennis and the largest operator of U.S. tennis events into pickleball. UTR Pickleball Rating (UTRP) levels are: P1 (beginner), P2 (advanced), P3 (intermediate), or P4 (expert/pro).

settings.description: You can play it at literally all the levels. It’s a great equalizer. You can imagine, when you take the serve out, how many good rallies and points you’re going to have with UTR Dingles.
settings.author: Tommy Haas
settings.author-designation: Former World No. 2; champion of inaugural UTR Dingles Championships

settings.description: I like the way that UTR Sports is working with tennis players at all skill levels to engage with the sport and continue to find competitive ways to grow as a player.
settings.author: Chris Young
settings.author-designation: Oklahoma State University Director of Tennis; Head Coach,  Women's Tennis

settings.description: Dingles is basically the game of my childhood on the court. I love dingles.
settings.author: Alex de Minaur

settings.heading: Join UTR Sports in 3 easy steps
settings.paragrap-title: It’s easier than ever to enjoy more tennis and pickleball and connect with players near you on the UTR Sports app.
